result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Assignment of Judge - Unable to Forward per USPS
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on November 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Competency hearing on November 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:44 PM cases 22CF1090 and 22CF1109 called. Defendant Sandra L Zavislak in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Sandra L Zavislak.  Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense raises competency in both files. Court finds probable cause in both matters to order a cash bond. 
Defense addresses bond in 22CF1090: Asks for a bond modification with argument.  
State objects to any bond modification with argument. 
Court denies a bond modification. Defendant makes a statement. 
Matters are to be scheduled for a competency hearing in branch 2.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:08 AM.
Defendant Sandra L Zavislak appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Complaint. State requests $1000 Cash Bond (No ties to EC, open cases in Chippewa). Court orders $500 Cash Bond.
Preliminary Hearing: 10/18/22 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions: 
Defendant not to have violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
